abstract.p: European Commission approves $24.3 billion acquisition of US food company Bestfoods by Unilever PLC; under European Commission's condition for approval, Unilever must sell brands and businesses worth $440 million in annual sales (S)

block.p: The European Commission said it had approved the $24.3 billion acquisition of the United States food company Bestfoods by Unilever P.L.C., the British-Dutch food and consumer goods conglomerate. Under the European Commission's condition for approval, Unilever must shed brands and businesses worth $440 million in annual sales. Unilever said it had agreed to shed overlapping businesses like its Oxo bouillon cubes and Bestfood's Lesieur mayonnaise products in France. The Federal Trade Commission in the United States has approved the deal.
